sentence: Technology stocks still were edging lower again Tuesday afternoon, with shares of tech companies in the S&P 500 slipping almost 0.1% in value today while the Philadelphia semiconductor index was posting a more than 0.7% gain.

+ MuleSoft Inc. ( MULE ) raced to a best-ever $42.35 a share on Tuesday, climbing over 28% in frenzied volume, following reports Saleforce.com ( CRM ) is in advanced talks to acquire the maker of the Anypoint platform in a bid to supplement its cloud-based technology portfolio with new applications, according to Reuters, citing sources who asked not to be identified because the negotiations are confidential.
Salesforce and MuleSoft declined to comment when contacted by the news service.

+ BlackBerry Ltd (BB,BB.TO) Tuesday jumped over 5% to reach a session high of $13.38 a share after late Monday announcing a new strategic partnership with Microsoft ( MSFT ) and debuting the BlackBerry Enterprise Bridge, which provides a highly-secure way for enterprise customers to use Microsoft mobile apps from within BlackBerry Dynamics.
They also have combined the BlackBerry Secure platform with Microsoft's Azure cloud platform, making BlackBerry's UEM Cloud, Workspaces, Dynamics and AtHoc applications all available on Azure.

Separately, A U.S. District Court judge in Manhattan Monday allowed a shareholder lawsuit alleging Blackberry defrauded shareholders "by painting a misleadingly positive picture of sales prospects for its BlackBerry 10 smartphones" to proceed, citing new information about the company that surfaced during the criminal prosecution of a retail executive at a company selling Blackberry smartphones.

+ Blink Charging Co ( BLNK ) climbed almost 4% to a session high of $3.00 a share after saying it has purchased 112 electric vehicle charging stations installed throughout the greater Chicago region for an undisclosed amount from privately held JNS Power & Control Systems Inc.

The stations are located in high-traffic areas - including Chicago O'Hare and Midway airports, the John Hancock Center and North Ridge Plaza - as well as several shopping centers and parking garages in the city.
The acquisition increases Blink's ownership to more than 160 stations in Illinois.

- Oracle ( ORCL ) declined almost 11% on Tuesday, touching a session low of $46.43 a share, after analysts at Bank of America Merrill Lynch reduced their investment rating for the cloud-computing software firm to Neutral from Buy and cut their price target for Oracle stock by $5 to $57 a share.
The downgrade follows the company late Monday issuing a somewhat soft forecast for the current quarter ending in late May and upstaging fiscal Q3 net income beating Wall Street expectations.
The company is projecting Q4 revenue growth between 1% to 3% over year-ago compared with analyst estimates looking for a 2.5% year-over-year rise to $11.22 billion in revenue.
It also sees non-GAAP Q4 earnings in a range of $0.92 to $0.95 per share, topping the Capital IQ consensus by at least $0.02 per share.
Excluding one-time items, its earned $0.83 during the three months ended Feb. 28, up from $0.69 per share during the same quarter last year and exceeding the analyst mean by $0.11 per share.
Q3 revenue rose 6% year-over-year to $9.77 billion, matching Street views.
